p: We found the past survival rate of 90.6% was likely sufficient to maintain a stable population (λ ≥ 1) for all but one scenario: a solar cycle similar to the modern grand maximum with 500 ppm CO 2 (Figure 6). In this scenario, our model predicts annual survival would need to be increased to 91.0% (95% CI = 89.3%–93.4%; Figure 6). If the past population growth rate of 3.5% is to be maintained, then all scenarios with 500 ppm CO 2 would require increasing annual survival above its long‐term mean (Figure 6). For example, during a typical solar cycle with 500 ppm CO 2, our model predicts annual survival would need to be increased to 93.4% (95% CI = 91.8%–95.7%) to maintain 3.5% population growth (Figure 6).
